text: Patient shows repetitive hand flapping and strong interest in train schedules. Minimal eye contact observed during the interview.
Child communicates well with peers and enjoys group activities. No repetitive behaviors noted. Speech development is age-appropriate.
Subject demonstrates intense focus on lining up toys. Difficulty in understanding sarcasm. Sensitivity to loud noises.
Patient presents with anxiety but maintains good social reciprocity. Eye contact is normal. No fixated interests.
Observed echolalia and pronoun reversal. The child insists on wearing the same shirt every day.
